noun.description: An official, superintendent, or steward in a Muslim country; the title of such a person.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in William Foster (b. 1591), Church of England clergyman and writer. From Urdu nāẓir or its etymon Persian nāẓir from Arabic nāẓir superintendent, inspector, administrator, officer in a judicial court, use as noun of active participle of Arabic naẓara to see, view, examine.
